body_html: Hi @Arseny-N, indeed, my idea was that you should be able to pass a namedtuple as an argument to the model directly. Here you only pass a single tensor so you can just do batch.data, but sometimes you have a bunch of different tensors as inputs, and it's useful to pass everything to the model inside a namedtuple. This being said, we don't have to fix everything at once.

body: Hi @Arseny-N, indeed, my idea was that you should be able to pass a namedtuple as an argument to the model directly. Here you only pass a single tensor so you can just do `batch.data`, but sometimes you have a bunch of different tensors as inputs, and it's useful to pass everything to the model inside a namedtuple. This being said, we don't have to fix everything at once.
